Unique_IdentifierObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Unique_IdentifierObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Unique_IdentifierObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Assess_Candidate_Request_References.description: A reference to the Candidate Assessment to be returned to the caller.

Recruiting_AssessmentObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Recruiting_AssessmentObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Recruiting_AssessmentObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Assess_Candidate_Request_References.description: A reference to the Assessment to be returned to the caller.

description: References provided by the web service caller to indicate the Candidate Assessment information to return.

Job_ApplicationObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Job_ApplicationObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Job_ApplicationObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Assess_Candidate_Request_Criteria.description: The Candidate Assessments retrieved will be those associated with the referenced Job Application.

CandidateObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

CandidateObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

CandidateObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Job_Requisition_EnabledObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Job_Requisition_EnabledObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Job_Requisition_EnabledObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Candidate_Criteria.description: A reference to a Job Requisition that combined with the Candidate reference should result in precisely one Job Application with an in progress Candidate Assessment Event.

Assess_Candidate_Request_Criteria.description: A Candidate and optional Job Requisition reference that should be used to create or modify a Candidate Assessment.

Unique_IdentifierObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Unique_IdentifierObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Unique_IdentifierObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Assess_Candidate_Request_Criteria.description: The Candidate Assessments retrieved will be those associated with the referenced Job Application Event.
Only assessments created on or after this moment will be retrieved.
Only assessments prior to this moment will be retrieved.

description: Criteria used to determine which Candidate Assessment to return.

validation.validation: The From Moment must be less than the To Moment.
validation.description: The From Moment must be less than the To Moment.

validation.validation: To submit a candidate assessment request with Request Criteria, enter at least 1 of these criteria: Job Application Reference, Candidate Criteria Data, Job Application Event Reference, From Moment, To Moment.
validation.description: To submit a candidate assessment request with Request Criteria, enter at least 1 of these criteria: Job Application Reference, Candidate Criteria Data, Job Application Event Reference, From Moment, To Moment.

Response_Filter.description: Indicates the date when application data, such as benefits and compensation, become effective (Also referred to as the Effective Moment). If you don't specify a date, this date defaults to today.{+4}
The date and time the data was entered into the system. (This field is also referred to as the Entry Moment). If the date isn't specified, the default date is the current date and time.

The numbered page of data Workday returns in the response. The default page is the first page(Page = 1). For responses that contain more than one page of data, use this parameter to retrieve the additional pages of data. For example, set Page = 2 to retrieve the second page of data.Note: If you set the page parameter, you must also specify the "As_Of_Entry_Date" to ensure that the result set remains the same between your requests.
Sets the number of objects to return within each response page. Set a value between 1 and 999. The default value is 100.

description: Parameters that let you filter the data returned in the response. You can filter returned data by dates and page attributes.
